MultiLens.Cosmo package¶

Submodules¶

MultiLens.Cosmo.cosmo module¶

class MultiLens.Cosmo.cosmo.CosmoProp(param_file=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

class to compute cosmological distances

D_xy(z_observer, z_source)[source]¶

angular diamter distance :param z_observer: observer :param z_source: source :return:

T_xy(z_observer, z_source)[source]¶

transverse comoving distance :param z_observer: observer :param z_source: source :return:

a_z(z)[source]¶

returns scale factor (a_0 = 1) for given redshift

arcsec2phys(arcsec, z)[source]¶

computes the physical distance in Mpc given angle in arc seconds :param arcsec: :param z: :return:

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013 module¶

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.F = 1.14¶

*???* need to incorporate

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.Nnu = 3.046¶

Number of effective neutrino species need to incorporate

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.Tcmb = 2.7255¶

CMB temperature [in kelvin] need to incorporate

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.Yp = 0.24¶

Helium fraction need to incorporate

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.aini = 1e-07¶

a used as initial starting point for Boltzman calculation

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.cosmics_dir = '---'¶

COSMICS directory for recombination

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.fDM = 0.0¶

*???* need to incorporate

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.h = 0.6777¶

Hubble constant H0 = h*100km/s/Mpc

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.intamax = 1.0¶

maximum a value used for the interpolation routines

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.intamin = -1¶

mininum a value used for the interpolation routines (-1 sets to aini/1.1)

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.intnum = 100¶

number of points ussed in interpolation

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.n = 0.9611¶

Spectral index

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.omega_b = 0.0483¶

Baryon density (z=0)

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.omega_l_in = 'flat'¶

Dark energy density. If flat then omega_l is 1.- omega_m - omega_r

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.omega_m = 0.30860000000000004¶

Matter density (dark + baryonic) (z=0)

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.pk_nonlin_type = 'rev_halofit'¶

sets if the nonlinear matter power spectrum should be calculated using the halofit fitting function (‘halofit’) or the revised halofit fitting function (‘rev_halofit’)

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.pk_norm = 0.8288¶

Powerspectrum Normalisation (z=0)

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.pk_norm_type = 'sigma8'¶

Power spectrum normalisation scheme: ‘deltah’ for CMB normalisation or ‘sigma8’ for sigma8 normalisation

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.pk_type = 'EH'¶

sets is the linear perturbations should be calculated using boltzman solver (‘boltz’) or approximations (‘approx’)

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.recomb = '---'¶

code to compute recombination: ‘recfast++’ or ‘cosmics’

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.speed = 'slow'¶

fast (interpolations used) or slow - full calcs

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.tau = 0.0952¶

Optical depth

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.w0 = -1.0¶

DE equation of state

MultiLens.Cosmo.pycosmo_config_planck2013.wa = 0.0¶

DE equation of state evol: w(a)=w0+wa(1-a)
